topic: 21. India’s Mutual Fund Assets Cross Milestone – July 2025

subtopics.content:
• Industry AUM reported a new milestone in July 2025, reflecting sustained retail and institutional inflows.
• Systematic Investment Plan (SIP) contributions continued to be a key driver of net inflows for the month.
• Asset growth was broad-based across equity, hybrid and debt segments, with retail participation remaining strong.
• Fund houses highlighted higher allocations to large-cap funds and increased interest in thematic and ESG strategies.

topic: 22. RBI Tightens KYC & Customer Due Diligence Norms – July 2025

subtopics.subtopic: Regulatory update for onboarding and risk management
subtopics.content:
• RBI issued updated KYC guidelines in July 2025 tightening verification for high-risk and cross-border customers.
• Banks were instructed to enhance digital KYC controls, strengthen periodic re-KYC and monitor suspicious activity more closely.
• The update emphasised stricter verification for certain corporate and non-resident accounts and clearer audit trails.
• Industry bodies were asked to implement changes within defined timelines and report implementation progress to regulators.

topic: 23. Corporate Tax Receipts Improve in Monthly Account – July 2025

subtopics.content:
• Monthly corporate tax collections showed an uptick in July 2025 compared with recent months, helping improve short-term revenue momentum.
• The increase reflected improved corporate payouts and some one-off settlements recorded during the month.
• Officials noted stronger compliance measures and electronic filing efficiencies contributed to timelier collections.
• Analysts cautioned that corporate receipts can be lumpy and recommended monitoring quarterly trends for a clearer fiscal picture.

topic: 24. RBI Launches UPI Lite Expansion – July 2025

subtopics.content:
• RBI announced broader roll-out measures for the UPI Lite product to deepen small-value digital payments.
• The expansion targeted offline-capable and low-data users to improve financial inclusion in tier-2/3 towns.
• Several banks and third-party PSPs were invited to enable UPI Lite rails and integrate optional wallet-like features.
• Pilot feedback indicated faster transaction experience and lower friction for micro-payments at merchants.

topic: 25. Insurance Penetration Trends – July 2025

subtopics.content:
• IRDAI reported improving insurance penetration metrics in July 2025 driven by renewed product launches and digital distribution.
• Life and non-life insurers expanded digital onboarding and instant policy issuance for standard covers.
• Micro-insurance and rural-focused plans saw targeted marketing drives and tie-ups with fintech/BC networks.
• Regulators emphasised customer education and simpler grievance redress for growing retail adoption.

topic: 26. RBI Licenses New Payment Bank Entrants – July 2025

subtopics.content:
• RBI granted in-principle approvals to new payment bank candidates in July 2025 to widen last-mile digital payment access.
• The approvals came with strict capital, governance and technology readiness conditions to be satisfied before operations.
• The regulator emphasised interoperable infrastructure and robust cybersecurity measures for licensees.
• Market participants expected increased competition in small-ticket savings and retail payments following onboarding.

topic: 27. Export Credit Guarantee Scheme Revisions – July 2025

subtopics.content:
• ECGC revised certain scheme parameters in July 2025 to improve coverage and faster claims settlement for exporters.
• Changes included streamlined documentation, expanded product categories and targeted support for MSME exporters.
• The objective was to bolster competitiveness amid volatile global demand and supply-chain shifts.
• Export promotion agencies and trade bodies welcomed the measures, seeking further outreach and awareness drives.

topic: 28. RBI Issues Digital Lending Norms – July 2025

subtopics.content:
• RBI released a framework for digital lending platforms to address pricing transparency, grievance redress and data handling.
• Lenders and aggregator platforms were required to disclose full loan costs, sanctions and penalty clauses up front.
• The norms mandated stronger outsourcing controls, periodic audits, and caps on certain fees for small-value loans.
• The regulator emphasised borrower education, easier access to dispute resolution, and regular supervisory checks.

topic: 29. Trade Balance Developments – July 2025

subtopics.content:
• Trade data in July 2025 showed mixed signals with export volumes improving in some goods categories while imports remained steady.
• Services exports and remittances continued to provide an offset to merchandise trade pressures.
• Policymakers highlighted the need to ramp up value-added exports and diversify markets for sustainable trade balances.
• Logistics bottlenecks and commodity price swings were noted as near-term headwinds to trade stability.

topic: 30. Cash Reserve & Liquidity Measures – July 2025

subtopics.content:
• RBI implemented targeted liquidity operations and repo/reverse repo adjustments in July 2025 to manage systemic liquidity.
• The central bank used fine-tuning operations and variable-rate repos to smooth market repo rates and support credit flow.
• Treasury and market participants reported comfortable system liquidity with active participation in LAF and MSF windows.
• RBI reiterated commitment to price stability while ensuring adequate liquidity for economic activity.
